alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ada, southwestern Boise, northeastern Canyon and south central Gem Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bogus Basin Ski Area, or 11 miles north of Boise, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Boise, Hidden Springs and Bogus Basin Ski Area around 530 PM MDT. Garden City around 540 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
